name: market for internet access equipment | internet access equipment | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8266/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'internet access equipment', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is a mobile infrastructure, representing the product of an internet access equipment that is used to provide the service of internet connection. Tha system  includes ADSL modem with router, DSLAM and connecting cables, while it is based on the factsheet of the Zyxel IES-6000 Series DSLAM, which contains ports for 768 users (ZyXel 2009).  Its production represents all materials necessary to construct it and energy consumption during manufacturing.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'internet access equipment',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'internet access equipment',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
